H0.text: Become red supergiants is how very massive stars end their lives.

H1.text: Become super novas are the end state of very massive stars.

H2.text: Very massive stars explode at the end of their lives.

H3.text: Consumed by a black hole is the fate of very massive stars when they end their lives.

A4.text: A supernova occurs during the last evolutionary stages of a massive star.

A5.text: The core collapse may cause violent expulsion of the outer layers of the star resulting in a supernova.

A6.text: The resulting supernova explosion expels much or all of the stellar material with velocities as much as 10% the speed of light (or approximately 30,000 km/s)
